summary: This document outlines a request for scanning and automation assistance from the Document Conversion Laboratory in support of an obstruction of justice investigation involving Alfredo Rodriguez, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein. The document details the handling of telephone records believed to be linked to Epstein and potential underage victims.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Rodriguez is under investigation for attempting to sell an address book containing names and phone numbers of potential underage victims of Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is referenced as the subject of a child prostitution case, with connections to the address book in question.

connections.description: Rodriguez was employed as a house manager and butler for Epstein.

events.title: Obstruction of Justice Case Opened
events.description: The Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez attempted to sell an address book containing names and phone numbers of potential underage victims of Epstein.
The investigation into Rodriguez began in October 2009.
The document discusses the handling of telephone records believed to belong to Epstein and his associates.
Rodriguez's actions are considered obstruction of justice as he did not turn over the address book to law enforcement.
